items.title: How to manage threads with locks and custom condition with Spring?
items.body:
In a Spring application the goal is to have multiple threads running, 1 of each "type" at a time. When running together type1, type2, type3, type3, only the first 3 are running (concurrently), but the last one seems to stay blocked and doesn't run.

class MyClass{
    
    private ReentrantLock lock = new ReentrantLock();
    private Condition shouldRun = lock.newCondition();
    private Set<String> currentRunningTypes = Sets.newHashSet();

    @Async
    public void process(String type){
        try{
            log.info("Starting type {}", type);
            lock.lock();
            while(currentRunningTypes.contains(type)) {
                log.info("waiting for type {}", type);
                shouldRun.await();
            }
            currentRunningTypes.add(type);
            lock.unlock();

            doSomething(type);

        } finally {
            log.info("Type ended {}", type);
            if(lock.isLocked) {
                lock.unlock;
            }
        }

    }

    private void doSomething(String type) {
        //... process
        currentRunningTypes.remove(type)
        shouldRun.signalAll();
    }

}

The output:

Starting type type1
Starting type type2
Starting type type3
Starting type type4
waiting for type type4
Type ended type1
Type ended type2
Type ended type3

The expected output:

Starting type type1
Starting type type2
Starting type type3
Starting type type4
waiting for type type4
Type ended type1
Type ended type2
Type ended type3
Type ended type4

Why isn't the thread starting?

items.title: Cannot make a static reference to the non-static type T error in Java generic arraylist
items.body:
The task is to write a generic class that can create an array list for any possible data type. How can I properly reference T? The error message for ArrayGList iList = null; is: Cannot make a static reference to the non-static type T And for double doubleValue = value.doubleValue(); there are these: The method doubleValue() is undefined for the type T

Die Main:

import java.util.Scanner;

public class Aufgabe_2_Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {

        Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
        String menuD = "";
        int menuM = 0;
        ArrayGList <T> iList = null;

        /* DATENTYPAUSWAHL*/
        while (iList == null) {
            System.out.println("*******************************");
            System.out.printf("* Erstellung einer Arrayliste *%n");
            System.out.println("*******************************");
            System.out.printf("*    Auswahl des Datentyps    *%n");
            System.out.println("*******************************");
            System.out.printf("*           %-4s       *%n",  "Integer");
            System.out.printf("*           %-4s        *%n", "Double");
            //System.out.printf("*          %-2s | %-4s        *%n", "3", "String");
            //System.out.printf("*          %-2s | %-4s        *%n", "4", "FILLER");
            //System.out.printf("*          %-2s | %-4s          *%n", "5", "EXIT");
            System.out.println("*******************************" + '\n');

            switch (menuD = scanner.nextLine()) {
                case "Integer": //Integer
                    /*Objekt iList erstellen */
                    System.out.println("Wie lang soll Ihre Arrayliste sein?");
                    iList = new ArrayGList<Integer>(scanner.nextInt());
                    break;
                case "Double": // Double
                    /*Objekt iList erstellen */
                    System.out.println("Wie lang soll Ihre Arrayliste sein?");
                    iList = new ArrayGList<Double>(scanner.nextInt()); 
                    break;  
                default: //automatische ArrayList
                   System.err.println("Ungueltige Eingabe.. ");
                    //iList = new ArrayGList<Integer>(scanner.nextInt()); //Nur zur behebung der Fehlermeldungen vorhanden
                    break;
            }
        }

        /* METHODENAUSWAHL */
        while (menuM != 7) {
            System.out.println('\n' +"**********************");
            System.out.printf("*   METHODENAUSWAHL  *%n");
            System.out.printf("**********************%n");
            System.out.printf("*   %-2s | %-4s   *%n", "1", "getLength");
            System.out.printf("*   %-2s | %-4s  *%n", "2", "insertLast");
            System.out.printf("*   %-2s | %-4s    *%n", "3", "getFirst");
            System.out.printf("*   %-2s | %-4s *%n", "4", "deleteFirst");
            System.out.printf("*   %-2s | %-4s      *%n", "5", "search");
            System.out.printf("*   %-2s | %-4s       *%n", "6", "print");
            System.out.printf("*   %-2s | %-4s        *%n", "7", "EXIT");
            System.out.println("**********************" + '\n');

            switch (menuM = scanner.nextInt()) {
                case 1: //getLength()
                    System.out.println('\n' +"Laenge der Arrayliste: " + iList.getLength());
                    break;
                case 2: // insertLast()
                    System.out.println('\n' +"Welches Element wollen Sie der Arrayliste an letzter Stelle hinzufuegen?");
                    if(menuD == "Integer")
                        System.out.println((Integer)iList.insertLast(scanner.nextInt()));
                    if (menuD == "Double")
                        System.out.println((Double)iList.insertLast(scanner.nextDouble()));
                    break;
                case 3: // getFirst()
                    System.out.println('\n' +"Erstes Element der Liste: " + iList.getFirst());
                    break;
                case 4:// delete First()
                    System.out.println('\n' +"Element wird entfernt bei Ausgabe 0: " + iList.deleteFirst());
                    break;
                case 5:// search()
                    System.out.println('\n' +"Nach welchem Element soll gesucht werden?");
                    if (menuD == "Integer")
                        System.out.println((Integer)iList.search(scanner.nextInt()));
                    if (menuD == "Double")
                        System.out.println((Double)iList.search(scanner.nextDouble()));
                    break;
                case 6:// print()
                    System.out.println('\n' +"Ihre Arrayliste: ");
                    iList.print();
                    break;
                case 7: // exit
                    System.out.println('\n' + "Das Programm wird beendet.");
                    break;
            }
        }
            scanner.close();
    }
}

Die Interface-Klasse

public interface GList<T> {
    public int getLength();
    public int insertLast(T value);
    public T getFirst();
    public int deleteFirst();
    public boolean search (T value);
    public void print();
}

Die generische Klasse

public class ArrayGList <T> implements GList<T> {

    private T[] array;
    private int laenge = 10;

    /*
     * Konstruktor ArrayIntegerList(int)
     * laenge: wird an Array uebergeben und definiert Arraysgroesse
     */
    ArrayGList(int eingabe) {
        this.laenge = eingabe;
        this.array = (T[])new Object[this.laenge];
    }

    /*
     * Methode getLength()
     * Rueckgabetyp: Laenge des Arrays
     */
    public int getLength() {
        return this.laenge;
    }

    /*
     * Methode insertLast()
     * value: wert, der dem array hinzugefuegt wird
     * Rueckgabetyp: (-1) = nicht durchgefuehrt | (0) = durchgefuehrt
     */
    public int insertLast(T value) {
        for (int i = 0; i < this.array.length; i++) {
            if (isValueZero(value)) {
                this.array[i] = value;
                return 0;
            }
        }
        return -1;
    }

    /*
     * Methode getFirst()
     * Rueckgabetyp: (-9999) = Array leer | this.array[0] = erstes Element
     */
    public T getFirst() {
        if (getLength() == 0)
            return null;
        else
            return (T) this.array[0];
    }

    /*
     * Methode deleteFirst()
     * Rueckgabetyp: (-1) = nicht durchgefuehrt | (0) = durchgefuehrt
     */
    public int deleteFirst() {
        if (getLength() == 0)
            return -1;
        for (int i = 0; i < this.array.length - 1; i++)
            this.array[i] = this.array[i + 1]; // jeden Index mit dem Inhalt des darauf folgenden ueberschreiben
        this.array[this.array.length - 1] = null; // letzten Index 0 setzen
        return 0;
    }

    /*
     * Methode search()
     * value: wert, nach dem gesucht werden soll
     * Rueckgabetyp: true = Element enthalten | false = Element nicht enthalten
     */
    public boolean search(T value) {
        for (int i = 0; i < this.array.length; i++) {
            if ((this.array[i] != null) && (this.array[i].equals(value))) {
                return true; // Das Element wurde im Array gefunden
            }
        }
        return false; // Das Element wurde nicht im Array gefunden
    }
    
    /*
     * Methode print()
     */
    public void print() {
        for (int i = 0; i < this.array.length; i++) {
            System.out.println((i + 1) + ": " + this.array[i]);
        }
    }

    public static <T> boolean isValueZero(T value) {
        double doubleValue = value.doubleValue();
        return doubleValue == 0.0;
    }
}

Die Aufgabe ist, eine generische Klasse zu schreiben, die eine Array Liste für jeden möglichen Datentyp erstellen kann. Wie kann ich T richtig referenzieren? Die Fehlermeldung bei ArrayGList iList = null; lautet: Cannot make a static reference to the non-static type T Und bei double doubleValue = value.doubleValue(); gibt es diese: The method doubleValue() is undefined for the type T

items.title: How to fix corrupted video (green frames) after muxing using MediaMuxer and MediaCodec
items.body:
I am new to video encoding. I am trying to encode an mp4 video from an array of frame data byte[] that is saved from an rtp steam. To do this:

Here is my class where I encode the video:

public VideoCreator(EncodeParameters params) {
    this.width = params.width;
    this.bitrate = params.bitrate;
    this.height = params.height;
    this.color_format = params.color_format;
}

public boolean createMp4Video(FrameQueue.Frame[] frames, Context context) {

    try {
        // Set up MediaMuxer

        File test = new File(context.getFilesDir(), "video.mp4");
        this.muxer = new MediaMuxer(test.getAbsolutePath(), MediaMuxer.OutputFormat.MUXER_OUTPUT_MPEG_4);


        // Set up MediaCodec
        mMediaFormat = MediaFormat.createVideoFormat(codecName, width, height);
        mMediaFormat.setInteger(MediaFormat.KEY_COLOR_FORMAT, color_format);
        mMediaFormat.setInteger(MediaFormat.KEY_BIT_RATE, bitrate);
        mMediaFormat.setInteger(MediaFormat.KEY_FRAME_RATE, 30);
        mMediaFormat.setInteger(MediaFormat.KEY_I_FRAME_INTERVAL, 1);
        codec = MediaCodec.createEncoderByType(codecName);
        codec.configure(mMediaFormat, null, null, MediaCodec.CONFIGURE_FLAG_ENCODE);

        codec.start();



        // Process frames
        for (int i = 0; i < frames.length; i++) {
            offerEncoder(frames[i]);
        }

        // Stop and release resources
        muxer.stop();
        muxer.release();
        codec.stop();
        codec.release();


        Log.i("Video Creator", "MP4 video creation completed successfully.");
        return true;
    } catch (IOException e) {

        Log.e("IOException occurred during MP4 video creation: ", e.getMessage());
        if (codec != null) {
            codec.stop();
            codec.release();
        }
        if (muxer != null) {
            muxer.stop();
            muxer.release();
        }
        return false;
    }
}

public void offerEncoder(FrameQueue.Frame frame) {
    try {
        int inputBufferIndex = codec.dequeueInputBuffer(-1);
        if (inputBufferIndex >= 0) {
            ByteBuffer inputBuffer = codec.getInputBuffers()[inputBufferIndex];
            inputBuffer.clear();

            inputBuffer.put(frame.getData());

            codec.queueInputBuffer(inputBufferIndex, frame.getOffset(), width * height * 3 / 2, frame.getTimestamp(), 0);

        }

        MediaCodec.BufferInfo bufferInfo = new MediaCodec.BufferInfo();
        int outputBufferIndex = codec.dequeueOutputBuffer(bufferInfo, 1000);
        while (outputBufferIndex >= 0) {
            ByteBuffer outputBuffer = codec.getOutputBuffers()[outputBufferIndex];


            if (sps != null && pps != null) {

                muxer.writeSampleData(mVideoTrack, outputBuffer, bufferInfo);
                frameCount++;

            } else {

                byte[] outData = new byte[bufferInfo.size];
                outputBuffer.get(outData);

                //SPS
                if (outData[0] == 0x00 && outData[1] == 0x00 && outData[2] == 0x00 && outData[3] == 0x01 && outData[4] == 103) {
                    System.out.println("parsing sps/pps");
                } else {
                    System.out.println("something is amiss?");
                    break;
                }
                int ppsIndex = 1;

                while (!(outData[ppsIndex] == 0x00 && outData[ppsIndex + 1] == 0x00 && outData[ppsIndex + 2] == 0x00 && outData[ppsIndex + 3] == 0x01 && outData[ppsIndex + 4] == 104)) {
                    ppsIndex++;
                }

                sps = new byte[ppsIndex];
                System.arraycopy(outData, 0, sps, 0, sps.length);
                pps = new byte[outData.length - ppsIndex];
                System.arraycopy(outData, ppsIndex, pps, 0, pps.length);
                if (mVideoTrack == -1) {
                    mMediaFormat.setByteBuffer("csd-0", ByteBuffer.wrap(sps));
                    mMediaFormat.setByteBuffer("csd-1", ByteBuffer.wrap(pps));
                    this.mVideoTrack = muxer.addTrack(mMediaFormat);
                    muxer.start();
                }
            }
            codec.releaseOutputBuffer(outputBufferIndex, false);
            outputBufferIndex = codec.dequeueOutputBuffer(bufferInfo, 0);
        }
    } catch (Throwable t) {
        t.printStackTrace();
    }
}

and here is where I pass the frame data to start the encoding process:

items.title: Java records Generics : non-static type variable T cannot be referenced from a static context
items.body:
public record Result<T>() {
    private static ResultState state;
    private static Exception exception;
    private static T value;

    public Result(T value) {
        state = ResultState.Success;
        value = value;
        exception = null;
    }

    public Result(Exception e) {
        state = ResultState.Faulted;
        exception = e;
        value = null;
    }

    public static Supplier<Boolean> isFaulted = () -> state == ResultState.Faulted;

    public static Supplier<Boolean> isSuccess = () -> state == ResultState.Success;

    public void match(Consumer<T> succ, Consumer<Exception> fail) {
        if (isFaulted.get())
            fail.accept(exception);
        else
            succ.accept(value);
    }
}

Exception

error: non-static type variable T cannot be referenced from a static context
    private static T value;
               ^

items.title: Fetch POJOs grouped by an external field in JOOQ
items.body:
Take the usual example of the book and author tables in a many-to-many (book_author) relationship.

I currently have this and it works:

Map<UUID, List<Book>> booksByAuthorId = dsl
    .select(BOOK_AUTHOR.AUTHOR_ID, BOOK_AUTHOR.book())
    .from(BOOK_AUTHOR)
    .where(BOOK_AUTHOR.AUTHOR_ID.in(authorIds))
    .fetchGroups(
        BOOK_AUTHOR.AUTHOR_ID,
        mapping((a, bookRecord) -> mapping(Book::new).apply(bookRecord)));

but the nested mapping makes me feel I'm doing something wrong. Is that really the most obvious approach?

Were I to rewrite this using multiset, based on this example I'd expect it to look like this:

select(
        AUTHOR.ID,
        multiset(
            select(BOOK_AUTHOR.book())
            .from(BOOK_AUTHOR)                                        
            .where(BOOK_AUTHOR.AUTHOR_ID.eq(AUTHOR.ID)))
            .as("books").convertFrom(r -> r.map(mapping(Book::new)))
        .from(AUTHOR)
        .fetchMap(...)

But, similar to my first example, the types don't line up at all, as the mapper receives Record1<BookRecord> and expects BookRecord. So I instead have to write nesting mapping, yet again:

dsl.select(
        AUTHOR.ID,
        multiset(
            select(BOOK_AUTHOR.book())
            .from(BOOK_AUTHOR)
            .where(BOOK_AUTHOR.AUTHOR_ID.eq(AUTHOR.ID)))
            .as("books")
            //👇 seems wrong
            .convertFrom(r -> r.map(mapping((b) -> mapping(Book::new).apply(b)))))
        .from(AUTHOR)
        .fetchMap(AUTHOR.ID, mapping((a, b) -> b));

EDIT:

Here's my final take on multiset based on Lukas' answer:

dsl.select(
    AUTHOR.ID,
    multiset(
            select(BOOK_AUTHOR.book().mapping(Book::new))
            .from(BOOK_AUTHOR)
            .where(BOOK_AUTHOR.AUTHOR_ID.eq(AUTHOR.ID)))
            .as("books").convertFrom(r -> r.map(Record1::value1)))
    .from(AUTHOR)
    .fetchMap(AUTHOR.ID, Record2::value2);

items.title: Reading subfolders within the registry (JAVA)
items.body:
I'm busy creating a program that will read parts of the registry to find out what USB devices have been connected to a windows system etc... I've managed to create a piece of software what will display the values, however each person's registry will hold different information.

I've tried looking everywhere to find help/guidence with code to be able to scan a registry folder and display the subfolders within it. I know there is plenty of code for reading ordinary file locations however none will work with attempting to read the registry.

The folder location I am trying to read is:

"\"HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Enum\USBSTOR\

I've managed to create a program which will read the values from the above location however I have to manualy specify each subfolder into the code.

I hope i've explained what i need, sorry if it's confusing

Thanks in advance

items.title: How Selenium 4 NetworkInterceptor works internally
items.body:
In Selenium 4 , there is provision to intercept network by below code: NetworkInterceptor interceptor = new NetworkInterceptor( driver, Route.matching(req -> true) .to(() -> req -> new HttpResponse() .setStatus(200) .addHeader("Content-Type", MediaType.HTML_UTF_8.toString()) .setContent(utf8String("Creamy, delicious cheese!"))));

my question is that I never use that variable interceptor, then how or who usage it?

items.title: Mapping Regular Data Types to ClickHouse JDBC Supported Data Types in Kotlin
items.body:
I'm currently working on a Kotlin/Java/Gradle project where I'm interfacing with ClickHouse using their JDBC driver. I'm writing a function that generates a ClickHouse file based on a given list of columns with associated data types.

My primary issue is with the mapping of regular data types to the supported ClickHouse data types via the JDBC driver. I currently have a mapping as follows:

val dataTypes = mapOf(
    "int" to "Int32",
    "float" to "Decimal32(2)",
    "float64" to "Decimal64(2)",
    "boolean" to "Bool",
    "string" to "String",
    "date" to "Date",
    "datetime" to "DateTime"
)

This mapping does not cover all the data types that the ClickHouse JDBC driver supports, and I'm struggling to create a comprehensive and accurate mapping between the regular data types and these supported data types. The supported data types are:

  • Array(*)
  • Bool
  • Date*
  • DateTime*
  • Decimal*
  • Enum*
  • Geo Types (Point, Ring, Polygon, and MultiPolygon)
  • Int*, UInt* (UInt64 is mapped to long)
  • IPv*
  • Map(*)
  • Nested(*)
  • Object('JSON')
  • SimpleAggregateFunction
  • *String
  • Tuple(*)
  • UUID

Specifically, I'm facing issues when dealing with float, decimal, and date and datetime data types. I'm not sure about the best practices to handle these types in ClickHouse and I'd appreciate any guidance on how to map these types properly.

In addition, I'm looking for advice on handling specific edge cases, such as how to handle the UUID generation for 'increment' generator columns, and the proper casting of the different ClickHouse data types when inserting the values into the table.

Here is the function I'm working on for reference:

override fun getGeneratedFileClickhouse(file: File, rows: Int, columns: List<ColumnSettings>, tableName: String): InputStreamResource {

        val dummyTable = getGeneratedList(rows, columns)
        val tableName = tableName
        val columnNames = columns.joinToString(", ") { it.name }
        val dataTypes = mapOf(
            "int" to "Int32",
            "float" to "Decimal32(2)",
            "float64" to "Decimal64(2)",
            "boolean" to "Bool",
            "string" to "String",
            "date" to "Date",
            "datetime" to "DateTime"
        )



        try {
            val writer = FileWriter(file)

            // Generate the CREATE TABLE statement
            writer.write("CREATE TABLE $tableName (\n")
            var primaryKey = ""
            for (column in columns) {
                val dataType = dataTypes[column.dataType]
                writer.write("  ${column.name} $dataType")
                if (column.generator == "increment") {
                    if (column.dataType != "int") {
                        throw IllegalArgumentException("The 'increment' generator can only be applied to 'int' columns. Column '${column.name}' has dataType '${column.dataType}'.")
                    }
                    writer.write(" DEFAULT generateUUIDv4()")
                    primaryKey = column.name
                }
                writer.write(",\n")
            }


            if (primaryKey.isNotEmpty()) {
                writer.write("  PRIMARY KEY ($primaryKey)\n")
                writer.write(") ENGINE = MergeTree ORDER BY $primaryKey;\n\n")
            } else {
                writer.write(") ENGINE = MergeTree();\n\n")  // no ORDER BY
            }

            // Generate the INSERT INTO statements
            for ((indexRow, row) in dummyTable.withIndex()) {

                // Head line with column names
                if (indexRow == 0) continue

                writer.write("INSERT INTO $tableName ($columnNames) VALUES (")
                for ((index, column) in columns.withIndex()) {
                    val value = when (dataTypes[column.dataType]) {
                        "Int32" -> row.fields[index].toInt()
                        "Decimal32(2)", "Decimal64(2)" -> row.fields[index].toDouble()
                        "Bool" -> if (row.fields[index] == "true") "1" else "0"
                        "String" -> "'${row.fields[index]}'"
                        "Date" -> "toDate('${row.fields[index]}')"
                        "DateTime" -> "toDateTime('${row.fields[index]}')"
                        else -> error("Unknown data type: ${column.dataType}")
                    }


                    writer.write("$value")
                    if (index < columns.count() - 1) writer.write(", ")
                }
                writer.write(");\n")
            }

            writer.close()
        } catch (e: IOException) {
            e.printStackTrace()
        }

        val inputStream = FileInputStream(file)

        return InputStreamResource(inputStream)
    }
}

I tried to map my standard data types to the ClickHouse JDBC supported data types using a Kotlin Map. I've been testing this using a function that generates a ClickHouse file. I've attempted to handle the generation of UUID for 'increment' generator columns in this function.

I expected that my existing mapping would cover all cases, but it doesn't accommodate all the data types supported by ClickHouse JDBC. When handling the 'increment' generator columns, I anticipated that the UUID would be generated for each new increment.

items.title: How to solve 'PusherAuthentication failed' error when trying to subscribe to a private channel with authorization using Soketi and Java Pusher client?
items.body:
I am working on a Laravel application using the Soketi library and Java Pusher client to transfer data using a Pusher-supported server.

However, I encountered an unexpected error: "PusherAuthentication failed: java.io.IOException: Server returned HTTP response code: 403 for URL."

Additional Details:

--Here are a few relevant files:

channels.php in Laravel:

<?php

Broadcast::channel('private-{id}', function ($user) {
    return true; // always return true for testing
});
  1. BroadcastServiceProvider in Laravel:
class BroadcastServiceProvider extends ServiceProvider
{
    public function boot(): void
    {
        Broadcast::routes(['middleware' => ['auth:sanctum']]); // im using sanctum's tokens to authorize user
        require base_path('routes/channels.php');
    }
}
  1. On the client side, I am using the Java Pusher client SDK. Here is the relevant code snippet:
public PusherConnector(String bearer) {
    try {
        PusherOptions options = new PusherOptions();
        HttpChannelAuthorizer channelAuthorizer = new HttpChannelAuthorizer("http://localhost/broadcasting/auth"); // this is my broadcasting endpoint from Laravel's package
        HashMap<String, String> headers = new HashMap<>();
        headers.put("Authorization", "Bearer " + bearer); // bearer token from sanctum
        channelAuthorizer.setHeaders(headers);

        options.setHost("localhost")
            .setWsPort(6001).setUseTLS(false).setChannelAuthorizer(channelAuthorizer);

        Pusher pusher = new Pusher("MY-PUSHER-APIKEY", options);
        pusher.connect(new ConnectionEventListener() {
            @Override
            public void onConnectionStateChange(ConnectionStateChange change) {
                System.out.println("Pusher" + "State changed from " + change.getPreviousState() + " to " + change.getCurrentState());
                System.out.println(pusher.getConnection().getSocketId());
            }

            @Override
            public void onError(String message, String code, Exception e) {
                System.out.println("Pusher" + "There was a problem connecting! " + "\ncode: " + code + "\nmessage: " + message + "\nException: " + e);
            }
        }, ConnectionState.ALL);

        PrivateChannel cn = pusher.subscribePrivate("private-" + bearer, new PrivateChannelEventListener() {
            @Override
            public void onAuthenticationFailure(String s, Exception e) {
                System.out.println("Pusher" + "Authentication failed: " + s);
            }

            @Override
            public void onSubscriptionSucceeded(String s) {
                System.out.println("Pusher" + "Subscription succeeded: " + s);
            }

            @Override
            public void onEvent(PusherEvent pusherEvent) {
                System.out.println("Pusher" + " -> Event received: " + pusherEvent.getData());
            }

            @Override
            public void onError(String message, Exception e) {
                PrivateChannelEventListener.super.onError(message, e);
            }
        });
    } catch (Exception e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
}
  1. and the current output ( from the java program ): Output:
PusherState changed from DISCONNECTED to CONNECTING
null // the socket id ( not yet connected )
PusherState changed from CONNECTING to CONNECTED
6069547637.4178363411 // the socket id
PusherAuthentication failed: java.io.IOException: Server returned HTTP response code: 403 for URL: http://localhost/broadcasting/auth // the error

Edit: tried removing the sanctums Auth Middleware and still throwing the same response (403)

Change password controller

@PublicController
@RequestMapping("/change-password")
@SessionAttributes("changePasswordFormObject")
public class PublicChangePasswordController {

    private SecurityService securityService;

    @Autowired
    public PublicChangePasswordController(SecurityService securityService) {
        super();
        this.securityService = securityService;
    }

    @InitBinder
    public void initBinder(WebDataBinder binder) {
        binder.setValidator(new ChangePasswordFormObjectValidator(securityService));
    }

    @RequestMapping()
    public ModelAndView display(WebRequest webRequest) {

        String username = (String) webRequest.getAttribute(DefaultAuthenticationFailureHandler.PASSWORD_CHANGE_USERNAME, RequestAttributes.SCOPE_SESSION);

        if (!StringUtils.hasText(username)) {
            // Redirect if no username is found on the session - user must have accessed it directly
            return new ModelAndView("redirect:/");
        }

        ChangePasswordFormObject formObject = new ChangePasswordFormObject();
        formObject.setUsername(username);

        ModelAndView modelAndView = new ModelAndView("change-password/change-password");
        modelAndView.addObject("changePasswordFormObject", formObject);

        return modelAndView;
    }

    @RequestMapping("/save")
    public String changePassword(@ModelAttribute("changePasswordFormObject") @Valid ChangePasswordFormObject formObject, BindingResult bindingResult,
            WebRequest webRequest, SessionStatus sessionStatus) throws Exception {

        if (bindingResult.hasErrors()) {
            return "change-password/change-password";
        }

        ChangePasswordDetailsDto changePasswordDetailsDto = new ChangePasswordDetailsDto();
        changePasswordDetailsDto.setUsername(formObject.getUsername());
        changePasswordDetailsDto.setNewPassword(formObject.getNewPassword());

        securityService.changePassword(changePasswordDetailsDto);

        webRequest.removeAttribute(DefaultAuthenticationFailureHandler.PASSWORD_CHANGE_USERNAME, RequestAttributes.SCOPE_SESSION);
        sessionStatus.setComplete();

        return "redirect:/";
    }
}

items.title: how to access grandparent attribute in the child class with same name as some attribute in child class
items.body:
I was tinkering with classes and objects, then I had a doubt, since all the non-private methods and variables/attributes are available to the child class, and if there is any attribute in the parent class with the same name as some attribute in the child class, the it can be accessed using super.attrName. But what if this is the situation in case of multi-level-inheritence, and you want to access the grandparent attribute in the child class, how can it be done. using super.super.attrName gives error.

my sample code

public class Main {

        Abc sahil = new Abc();
        System.out.println(sahil.length);
    }
}

class A {
    int length;

    A() {
        this.length = 1;
    }
}

class Ab extends A {
    int length;
    
    Ab() {
        this.length = 2;
    }
}

class Abc extends Ab {
    int length;

    Abc() {
        this.length = 3;
    }
}

items.title: Index Flux (Spring Webflux) to ElasticSearch using ElasticSearch-Java
items.body:
What I am trying to achieve:

1 - From a Flux (Spring Webflux, Reactor)

2 - Index/Save/Insert each element of the flux inside ElasticSearch, using the bulk API (not one by one) of elasticsearch-java https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/client/java-api-client/current/indexing-bulk.html#_indexing_application_objects (not using spring data elasticsearch)

3 - Retain the flux from step 2 in order to do some further processing

What did I try:

@Service
public final class SomeService implements CommandLineRunner {

    @Autowired
    ElasticsearchClient elasticsearchClient;

    @Override
    public void run(final String[] args) throws IOException {
        Flux<Product> productFlux = Flux.interval(Duration.ofSeconds(1)).map(i -> new Product(LocalDateTime.now().toEpochSecond(ZoneOffset.UTC), String.valueOf(i)));
        Flux<Product> savedFlux = saveAll(productFlux);
        Flux<CompletedProduct> completedProductFlux = savedFlux.map(oneSavedProduct -> toOneCompletedProduct(oneSavedProduct));
        savedFlux.subscribe();
    }

    private Flux<Product> saveAll(Flux<Product> productFlux) throws IOException {
        BulkRequest.Builder br = new BulkRequest.Builder();
        for (Product product : productFlux.toIterable()) { // changed here
            br.operations(op -> op
                    .index(idx -> idx
                            .index("products")
                            .document(product)
                    )
            );
        }
        BulkResponse result = elasticsearchClient.bulk(br.build());
        System.out.println("print " + result.ingestTook());
        if (result.errors()) {
            System.out.println("Bulk had errors");
            for (BulkResponseItem item: result.items()) {
                if (item.error() != null) {
                    System.out.println(item.error().reason());
                }
            }
        }
        return productFlux;
    }

    private CompletedProduct toOneCompletedProduct(Product oneSavedProduct) {

    }

}

items.title: getSubject() method rerturn null when trying to extract from JWT claims
items.body:
When I create JWT token string and try to extract login (subject), getLogin() method returns null. getLogin() method just wraps Claims.getSubject().

JWTService.java

@Service
public class JWTService {

    private static final SecretKey key = Keys.secretKeyFor(SignatureAlgorithm.HS256);

    @Value("${jwt.token-validity}")
    private Integer tokenValidity;

    @Nullable
    public String getLogin(@NotNull String token) {
        return extractClaim(token, Claims::getSubject);
    }

    private Claims getClaims(@NotNull String token) {
        return Jwts
                .parserBuilder()
                .setSigningKey(key)
                .build()
                .parseClaimsJws(token)
                .getBody();
    }

    private <T> T extractClaim(@NotNull String token, @NotNull Function<Claims, T> claimsResolver) {
        return claimsResolver.apply(getClaims(token));
    }

    public String generateToken(@NotNull String login) {
        return generateToken(login, new HashMap<>());
    }

    public String generateToken(@NotNull String login, @NotNull HashMap<String, Object> extraClaims) {
        return Jwts.builder()
                .setSubject(login)
                .setClaims(extraClaims)
                .setIssuedAt(new Date())
                .setExpiration(new Date(System.currentTimeMillis() + tokenValidity * 1000))
                .signWith(key)
                .compact();
    }
}

JWTServiceTest.java

@SpringBootTest(webEnvironment = SpringBootTest.WebEnvironment.RANDOM_PORT)
@FieldDefaults(level = AccessLevel.PRIVATE)
public class JWTServiceTest {

    @Autowired
    JWTService jwtService;

    @Test
    public void whenGivenTestLoginAndJwtGenerated_ThenExtractTestUsername(){
        String jwt = jwtService.generateToken("test");
        assertEquals("test", jwtService.getLogin(jwt));
    }
}

expected: <test> but was: <null>
Expected :test
Actual   :null

I tried to search same topics here, but don't found a solution.

items.title: TSP solver without triangle inequality
items.body:
I am interested in solving the TSP for (small) grid graphs. Any sort of library will do for me, but this seems to be harder than expected. I tried a couple of solvers I found out there (including concorde), but they all seem to have problems when the triangle inequality does not hold.

For instance, I would like the solver to output the tour (0, 1, 2, 1, 4, 3) for the graph (with unit edge weights) below:

0-1-2
| |
3-4

In this particular case, I told concorde that the edge (2, 4) had weight 1000 and concorde promptly produced the tour (0, 1, 2, 4, 3) of cost 1004. This is clearly not what I am looking for.

Ideally, there would be some simple (possibly brute force) implementation in Java, but anything which works will actually do. Can anyone point me to some code or do I really have to go an implement this myself?

Edit: also, it is important that I get an exact solution, not some approximation.

Edit2: indeed, this does not seem to be TSP. What I am trying to find is a shortest closed walk which visits all vertices.

items.body:
can you help me find the problem of my code, i just joined. wandering if you can help me with this one.

import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.FlowLayout;
import java.awt.GridLayout;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import java.io.*;
import java.util.List;
import javax.swing.*;
import java.util.ArrayList;

class Music implements Serializable {
    private String title;
    private String artist;
    private String genre;
    private double price;
    private boolean purchased;

    public Music(String title, String artist, String genre, double price) {
        this.title = title;
        this.artist = artist;
        this.genre = genre;
        this.price = price;
        this.purchased = false;
    }

    public String getTitle() {
        return title;
    }

    public String getArtist() {
        return artist;
    }

    public String getGenre() {
        return genre;
    }

    public double getPrice() {
        return price;
    }

    public boolean isPurchased() {
        return purchased;
    }

    public void purchase() {
        purchased = true;
    }

    @Override
    public String toString() {
        return title + " - " + artist;
    }
}

class MusicStoreGUI extends JFrame {
    private MusicStore musicStore;
    private DefaultListModel<String> catalogModel;
    private JList<String> catalogList;
    private JTextField searchField;
    private User currentUser;

    public MusicStoreGUI() {
        musicStore = new MusicStore();

        setTitle("Online Music Store");
        setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
        setLayout(new BorderLayout());

        JPanel catalogPanel = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());

        catalogModel = new DefaultListModel<>();
        catalogList = new JList<>(catalogModel);
        JScrollPane catalogScrollPane = new JScrollPane(catalogList);
        catalogPanel.add(catalogScrollPane, BorderLayout.CENTER);

        JPanel searchPanel = new JPanel(new FlowLayout());
        JLabel searchLabel = new JLabel("Search:");
        searchField = new JTextField(20);
        JButton searchButton = new JButton("Search");
        searchPanel.add(searchLabel);
        searchPanel.add(searchField);
        searchPanel.add(searchButton);
        catalogPanel.add(searchPanel, BorderLayout.SOUTH);

        add(catalogPanel, BorderLayout.CENTER);

        JPanel controlPanel = new JPanel(new GridLayout(0, 1));
        JButton addMusicButton = new JButton("Add Music");
        JButton removeMusicButton = new JButton("Remove Music");
        JButton updateMusicButton = new JButton("Update Music");
        JButton purchaseMusicButton = new JButton("Purchase Music");
        JButton viewPurchasesButton = new JButton("View Purchases");
        JButton viewTotalSalesButton = new JButton("View Total Sales");
        JButton viewSalesByGenreButton = new JButton("View Sales by Genre");
        JButton toggleSubscriptionButton = new JButton("Toggle Subscription");
        JButton exitButton = new JButton("Exit");
        controlPanel.add(addMusicButton);
        controlPanel.add(removeMusicButton);
        controlPanel.add(updateMusicButton);
        controlPanel.add(purchaseMusicButton);
        controlPanel.add(viewPurchasesButton);
        controlPanel.add(viewTotalSalesButton);
        controlPanel.add(viewSalesByGenreButton);
        controlPanel.add(toggleSubscriptionButton);
        controlPanel.add(exitButton);

        add(controlPanel, BorderLayout.EAST);

        searchButton.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
            public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
                String keyword = searchField.getText();
                searchMusic(keyword);
            }
        });

        addMusicButton.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
            public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
                showAddMusicDialog();
            }
        });

        removeMusicButton.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
            public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
                int selectedIndex = catalogList.getSelectedIndex();
                if (selectedIndex != -1) {
                    removeMusicFromCatalog(selectedIndex);
                } else {
                    JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(MusicStoreGUI.this, "Please select a music to remove.");
                }
            }
        });

        updateMusicButton.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
            public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
                int selectedIndex = catalogList.getSelectedIndex();
                if (selectedIndex != -1) {
                    showUpdateMusicDialog(selectedIndex);
                } else {
                    JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(MusicStoreGUI.this, "Please select a music to update.");
                }
            }
        });

        purchaseMusicButton.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
            public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
                int selectedIndex = catalogList.getSelectedIndex();
                if (selectedIndex != -1) {
                    purchaseMusic(selectedIndex);
                } else {
                    JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(MusicStoreGUI.this, "Please select a music to purchase.");
                }
            }
        });

        viewPurchasesButton.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
            public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
                viewPurchases();
            }
        });

        viewTotalSalesButton.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
            public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
                viewTotalSales();
            }
        });

        viewSalesByGenreButton.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
            public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
                viewSalesByGenre();
            }
        });

        toggleSubscriptionButton.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
            public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
                toggleSubscription();
            }
        });

        exitButton.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
            public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
                saveCatalogToFile();
                System.exit(0);
            }
        });

        loadCatalogFromFile();
        pack();
    }

    private void searchMusic(String keyword) {
        List<Music> searchResults = musicStore.searchMusicByTitle(keyword);
        catalogModel.clear();
        for (Music music : searchResults) {
            catalogModel.addElement(music.toString());
        }
    }

    private void showAddMusicDialog() {
        String title = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(this, "Enter music title:");
        String artist = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(this, "Enter artist name:");
        String genre = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(this, "Enter genre:");
        double price = Double.parseDouble(JOptionPane.showInputDialog(this, "Enter price:"));
        Music newMusic = new Music(title, artist, genre, price);
        addMusicToCatalog(newMusic);
    }

    public void addMusicToCatalog(Music music) {
        musicStore.addMusic(music);
        catalogModel.addElement(music.toString());
    }

    private void removeMusicFromCatalog(int index) {
        musicStore.removeMusic(index);
        catalogModel.remove(index);
    }

    private void showUpdateMusicDialog(int index) {
        Music music = musicStore.getMusic(index);
        String title = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(this, "Enter new music title:", music.getTitle());
        String artist = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(this, "Enter new artist name:", music.getArtist());
        String genre = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(this, "Enter new genre:", music.getGenre());
        double price = Double.parseDouble(JOptionPane.showInputDialog(this, "Enter new price:", music.getPrice()));
        Music updatedMusic = new Music(title, artist, genre, price);
        updateMusicInCatalog(updatedMusic, index);
    }

    public void updateMusicInCatalog(Music music, int index) {
        musicStore.updateMusic(music, index);
        catalogModel.set(index, music.toString());
    }

    private void purchaseMusic(int index) {
        if (currentUser == null) {
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this, "Please log in first.");
            return;
        }
        Music music = musicStore.getMusic(index);
        if (music.isPurchased()) {
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this, "You have already purchased this music.");
        } else {
            music.purchase();
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this, "You have successfully purchased the music:\n" + music);
        }
    }

    private void viewPurchases() {
        if (currentUser == null) {
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this, "Please log in first.");
            return;
        }
        List<Music> purchases = musicStore.getPurchaseHistory(currentUser);
        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
        for (Music music : purchases) {
            sb.append(music).append("\n");
        }
        JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this, "Your purchase history:\n" + sb.toString());
    }

    private void viewTotalSales() {
        double totalSales = musicStore.getTotalSales();
        JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this, "Total sales: $" + totalSales);
    }

    private void viewSalesByGenre() {
        String genre = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(this, "Enter genre:");
        double salesByGenre = musicStore.getSalesByGenre(genre);
        JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this, "Sales for genre " + genre + ": $" + salesByGenre);
    }

    private void toggleSubscription() {
        if (currentUser == null) {
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this, "Please log in first.");
            return;
        }
        currentUser.toggleSubscription();
        String message = currentUser.hasSubscription() ? "You have subscribed to the music store." : "You have unsubscribed from the music store.";
        JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this, message);
    }

    private void loadCatalogFromFile() {
        try {
            FileInputStream fileIn = new FileInputStream("catalog.ser");
            ObjectInputStream in = new ObjectInputStream(fileIn);
            List<Music> catalog = (List<Music>) in.readObject();
            musicStore.setCatalog(catalog);
            in.close();
            fileIn.close();
            for (Music music : catalog) {
                catalogModel.addElement(music.toString());
            }
        } catch (IOException | ClassNotFoundException e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }

    private void saveCatalogToFile() {
        try {
            FileOutputStream fileOut = new FileOutputStream("catalog.ser");
            ObjectOutputStream out = new ObjectOutputStream(fileOut);
            out.writeObject(musicStore.getCatalog());
            out.close();
            fileOut.close();
        } catch (IOException e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        SwingUtilities.invokeLater(new Runnable() {
            public void run() {
                new MusicStoreGUI().setVisible(true);
            }
        });
    }
}

items.title: Spring Webclient Flux fire and forget while keeping the flux
items.body:
What I would like to achieve

  • For each element of a Flux of MyPojo Flux<MyPojo>, send a http request with the json payload to a third party web service, fire and forget style, while being able to return the Flux for follow up processing.

Information

  • the third party web server, which I have no control over, takes 5 seconds constant time to process one request.

  • The third party server does not offer any bulk or list API, it is one by one

  • The third party server is known to be very reliable, I am allowed to hit it as hard as possible

  • I do not care that much about the response, especially, there is no value in waiting 5 seconds for a response I will do nothing with.

What I have tried

  • Using this code:
    private Flux<MyPojo> sendMyPojoFireAndForget(Flux<MyPojo> myPojoFlux) {
        return myPojoFlux.flatMap(oneMyPojo -> webClient.post().uri("http://example.com/path").bodyValue(oneMyPojo).exchangeToMono(clientResponse -> Mono.just(oneMyPojo)));
    }

However, this is not fire and forget. With proper logs on my side and seeing some logs from the third party, it seems I am waiting for the response.

I also tried

webClient.post()
            .uri("http://example.com/path")
            .bodyValue(oneMyPojo)
            .retrieve()
            .bodyToMono(Void.class)
            .subscribe();

But this will make me "lose" the Flux of MyPojo and end up with a Flux of Void instead

Question:

  • How to send each element of the Flux to this external webserver fire and forget style, while retaining the entire flux for downstream processing?

items.title: The CGLIB enhancement can not work after I introduce the spring-boot-starter-data-jpa
items.body:
The @Cacheable and @CachePut annotation works well before I introduce the spring-boot-starter-data-jpa.

It is the bean with @Cacheable and @CachePut annotation:

@Service
@CacheConfig(cacheNames="restTemplate")
public class BasicAuthRestTemplate {


    @Cacheable(key = "#email")
    public RestTemplate getRestTemplate(String email) {

        return null;
    }


    @CachePut(key = "#email")
    public RestTemplate getRestTemplate(String email, String password) {

        return new RestTemplateBuilder().basicAuthentication(email, password).build();
    }

}

The following is the launched log info, That is to say, when the system according to the specific conditions, decides to use the CglibAutoProxyConfiguration, the CGLIB function ceases to work

the bean can not be enhanced by CGLIB:

   AopAutoConfiguration.AspectJAutoProxyingConfiguration matched:
      - @ConditionalOnClass found required class 'org.aspectj.weaver.Advice' (OnClassCondition)

   AopAutoConfiguration.AspectJAutoProxyingConfiguration.CglibAutoProxyConfiguration matched:
      - @ConditionalOnProperty (spring.aop.proxy-target-class=true) matched (OnPropertyCondition)


   AopAutoConfiguration.ClassProxyingConfiguration:
      Did not match:
         - @ConditionalOnMissingClass found unwanted class 'org.aspectj.weaver.Advice' (OnClassCondition)    
      
================================================================================================      
      
the bean can be enhaced by CGLIB :


   AopAutoConfiguration.ClassProxyingConfiguration matched:
      - @ConditionalOnMissingClass did not find unwanted class 'org.aspectj.weaver.Advice' (OnClassCondition)
      - @ConditionalOnProperty (spring.aop.proxy-target-class=true) matched (OnPropertyCondition)
      
      
   AopAutoConfiguration.AspectJAutoProxyingConfiguration:
      Did not match:
         - @ConditionalOnClass did not find required class 'org.aspectj.weaver.Advice' (OnClassCondition)

If I exclude the aspectjweaver in the spring-boot-starter-data-jpa dependency, it will work well as before. So I can confirm that adding this dependency caused CGLIB functionality to fail.

<dependency>
    <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
    <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-data-jpa</artifactId>
    <exclusions>
        <exclusion>
            <groupId>org.aspectj</groupId>
            <artifactId>aspectjweaver</artifactId>
        </exclusion>
    </exclusions>
</dependency>

I find out that the spring will invoke the method bd.hasMethodOverrides() in the class SimpleInstantiationStrategy, if the method returns true, the spring will generate the CGLIB subclass as the instance of the bean.

But now the method bd.hasMethodOverrides() return false, so I can not get the CGLIB subclass so and the cache behavior also failed.

I want the @Cacheable annotation can work correctly and without excluding the aspectjweaver dependency

items.title: How can I aggregate paths from multiple completely unrelated OpenAPI files?
items.body:
Related: How do I combine multiple OpenAPI 3 specification files together?

context:

I am working on a maven plugin that packages some files that I need along with the jar. One of those files is an openapi file which I call component-descriptor.yaml.

My development involves capturing the component-descriptor.yaml of the direct dependencies of this project as well, and "aggregating them" to the one of the current project. Please note that these files are completely independent of each other with no $ref as mentioned in the other post.

I was able to retrieve the component-descriptor.yaml of all direct dependencies and parse them (individually) using io.swagger.

requirement:

What I specifically need to aggregate are the paths specified in the component-descriptor.yaml of those dependencies into the original file. I don't care about any of the other details like info, tags, etc.

Realistically, I am able to parse the files into java objects and concatenate the list of paths into a single object, but then I'm not sure if there is a way to turn that back into an openapi file. Couldn't find anything in swagger that supports such a reverse functionality.

I also can't use $ref or anything like that because the modules do not depend on each other.

private List<MobileSearch> sortAscAndDesc(final MobilesPostResponse mobilesPostResponse,
            final String[] split,
            final Comparator<MobileSearch> comparing) {

        final var direction = getDirection(split);

        final var modifiableList = new ArrayList<MobileSearch>(mobilesPostResponse.getMobiles());

        final var comparator = direction.equals(Constants.ASC)
                ? comparing.thenComparing(Comparator.nullsLast(comparing))
                : comparing.thenComparing(Comparator.nullsFirst(comparing.reversed()));

        modifiableList.sort(comparator);
        return modifiableList;
    }

A comparator is passed as a parameter which is using several keyExtractors. You can see below some method calls :

final var sortedList = sortAscAndDesc(mobilesPostResponse, split, Comparator.comparing(MobileSearch::getMsisdn));

final var sortedList = sortAscAndDesc(mobilesPostResponse, split, Comparator.comparing(MobileSearch::getAssignedProfile));

All I want is to avoid getting NPE when applying the modifiableList.sort() in EVERY case, but with my piece of code I can not achieve it. Any ideas?

items.title: How to suppress auto statement flushing in MyBatis
items.body:
Background

I want to implement the following procedure with Spring and MyBatis:

  1. Read a line from a CSV file
  2. Query a table (table ACCOUNT) with values read from the CSV file.
  3. Merge the values from the CSV file and table ACCOUNT into a record
  4. Insert the merged record into another table (REGISTRATION)

I want to use the batch executor (<setting name="defaultExecutorType" value="BATCH"/>) because this procedure inserts large number of records.

Problem

I have implemented the procedure like this:

AccountDao accountDao = applicationContext.getBean("accountDao", AccountDao.class);
RegistrationDao registrationDao = applicationContext.getBean("registrationDao", RegistrationDao.class);

List<Registration> list = null;
try (BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(new FileInputStream(path), "UTF-8"))) {

    CsvToBeanBuilder<Registration> builder = new CsvToBeanBuilder<Registration>(reader);
    builder.withType(Registration.class);

    list = builder.build().parse();
    for (Registration reg : list) {
        Account account = accountDao.findAccount(reg.getAccountId());
        reg.setName(account.getName());
            ...
        registrationDao.insertRegistration(reg);
    }
}

I have expected the INSERT SQL to be queued with JDBC Statement#addBatch(), and executed in a batch at the end of the transaction.

But in actually, MyBatis automatically flush every statement with BatchExecutor#doFlushStatements() when I query ACCOUNT table with AccountDao#findAccount(), so all INSERT SQL are executed separately.

In this situation, ACCOUNT has no relation to REGISTRATION, so you can safely queue the update statements and execute them in a batch.

Question

Is there any way to suppress automated flushing of queued statements when the developer knows the queried tables have no relation to the updated tables?

I created a map using leaflet and i'm trying to send point / multipolygon drawns to my postgres database using spring data JPA. The server initially receives a string geoJSON ( converted to org.locationtech.jts.geom.MultiPolygon and org.locationtech.jts.geom.Point by the follow deserialize methods ). Obs: I took care that the geojson string is always valid

import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonParser;
import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.DeserializationContext;
import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonDeserializer;
import org.locationtech.jts.geom.MultiPolygon;
import java.io.IOException;
import org.locationtech.jts.io.ParseException;
import org.locationtech.jts.io.geojson.GeoJsonReader;

public class MultiPolygonDeserializer extends JsonDeserializer<MultiPolygon> {

    @Override
    public MultiPolygon deserialize(JsonParser parser, DeserializationContext context) throws IOException {
        String geoJson = parser.getValueAsString();
        GeoJsonReader reader = new GeoJsonReader();
        try {
            return (MultiPolygon) reader.read(geoJson);
        } catch (ParseException e) {
            throw new IOException(e);
        }
    }
}

import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonParser;
import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.DeserializationContext;
import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonDeserializer;
import org.locationtech.jts.geom.Point;

import org.locationtech.jts.io.ParseException;
import org.locationtech.jts.io.geojson.GeoJsonReader;

public class PointDeserializer extends JsonDeserializer<Point> {

    @Override
    public Point deserialize(JsonParser parser, DeserializationContext context) throws IOException {
        String geoJson = parser.getValueAsString();
        GeoJsonReader reader = new GeoJsonReader();
        try {
            return (Point) reader.read(geoJson);
        } catch (ParseException e) {
            throw new IOException(e);
        }
    }
}

items.title: OpenCSV: How to create CSV file from POJO with custom column headers and custom column positions?
items.body:
I have created a MappingsBean class where all the columns of the CSV file are specified. Next I parse XML files and create a list of mappingbeans. Then I write that data into CSV file as report.

I am using following annotations:

public class MappingsBean {

    @CsvBindByName(column = "TradeID")
    @CsvBindByPosition(position = 0)
    private String tradeId;

    @CsvBindByName(column = "GWML GUID", required = true)
    @CsvBindByPosition(position = 1)
    private String gwmlGUID;

    @CsvBindByName(column = "MXML GUID", required = true)
    @CsvBindByPosition(position = 2)
    private String mxmlGUID;

    @CsvBindByName(column = "GWML File")
    @CsvBindByPosition(position = 3)
    private String gwmlFile;

    @CsvBindByName(column = "MxML File")
    @CsvBindByPosition(position = 4)
    private String mxmlFile;

    @CsvBindByName(column = "MxML Counterparty")
    @CsvBindByPosition(position = 5)
    private String mxmlCounterParty;

    @CsvBindByName(column = "GWML Counterparty")
    @CsvBindByPosition(position = 6)
    private String gwmlCounterParty;
}

And then I use StatefulBeanToCsv class to write into CSV file:

File reportFile = new File(reportOutputDir + "/" + REPORT_FILENAME);
Writer writer = new PrintWriter(reportFile);
StatefulBeanToCsv<MappingsBean> beanToCsv = new 
                              StatefulBeanToCsvBuilder(writer).build();
beanToCsv.write(makeFinalMappingBeanList());
writer.close();

The problem with this approach is that if I use @CsvBindByPosition(position = 0) to control position then I am not able to generate column names. If I use @CsvBindByName(column = "TradeID") then I am not able to set position of the columns.

Is there a way where I can use both annotations, so that I can create CSV files with column headers and also control column position?

Regards, Vikram Pathania

items.title: Spring quietly doesn't load config if Config classes have Builder and no default constructor. Why doesnt startup fail?
items.body:
I am facing a situation where a previously working config load stopped working after the Lombok builder annotation was added to a Config class.

What's more perplexing is that Spring doesn't even fail startup or even warn in logs about this.

Here is an example:

@Configuration
@Data
@ConfigurationProperties(prefix = "app.export")
public class ExportConfig {

    private String folderPath;
    private Integer capacity;
    private String filename;

    private Map<String, ExportClientConfig> clientConfigurations;

    public ExportClientConfig getClientConfiguration(String account){
        return clientConfigurations.get(account);
    }
}

Here, the Map<String, ExportClientConfig> usually gets loaded with all values from the application.yaml

However, once @Builder is enabled on the ExportClientConfig class, Spring quietly ignores the fact that its not able to construct ExportClientConfig during startup.

Relevant section of the application.yml:

app:
  export:
    folderPath: /data/app/export
    capacity: 50
    filename: data.txt
    clientConfigurations:
      ACC1:
        code: ACC1-ABC
        center: 1001
        payCode: SDLKFJS
      ACC2:
        code: ACC2-XYZ
        center: 2001
        payCode: DSFKHKSDJF

If the @Builder alone is reverted, everything works fine. Otherwise, the clientConfigurations map is empty.

Is this behaviour documented anywhere? Is this expeted in Spring or, is it a bug?

  2. The other concern is when i make below changes, it gives me other sonar issue for two fields - jwtAuthenticationEntryPoint and jwtRequestFilter. The issue states " Inject this field value directly into filter chain, the only method that uses it". How can i fix this?

     @Configuration
 @EnableWebSecurity
 @EnableGlobalMethodSecurity(prePostEnabled = true)
 public class SecurityConfig {

 @Value("${SSL.ENABLE}")
 private boolean sslEnable;

 @Autowired
 private PasswordEncoder encoder;

 @Autowired
 private JwtAuthenticationEntryPoint jwtAuthenticationEntryPoint;

 @Autowired

 @Autowired

 @Autowired
 public void configureGlobal(AuthenticationManagerBuilder auth) throws Exception {
     // configure AuthenticationManager so that it knows from where to load

     auth.userDetailsService(jwtUserDetailsService).passwordEncoder(encoder);
 }

 @Bean

         AuthenticationConfiguration authConfig) throws Exception {
     return authConfig.getAuthenticationManager();
 }

 @Bean

     httpSecurity.csrf().disable()
             .authorizeRequests()
             .antMatchers("/authenticate").permitAll()
             .antMatchers("/user/updatePassword").permitAll()
            .anyRequest().authenticated()
             .and()                        .exceptionHandling().authenticationEntryPoint(jwtAuthenticationEntryPoint).and().sessionManagement()

     if (sslEnable) {
         httpSecurity.requiresChannel().anyRequest().requiresSecure();
     }


     httpSecurity.addFilterBefore(jwtRequestFilter, UsernamePasswordAuthenticationFilter.class);

items.title: Tracking the Usage Time doesn't work in Android Studio
items.body:
I have tried a lot of things and it is becoming frustrating. This is my first-year learning Android Programmation, I started that class in March along with others, so I really am sorry if there are any beginner mistakes in here. I am making a digital health app. I want it to count the unlock events and display the usage time. I was able to display the count the unlock events using a Receiver and a Service. I tried the same thing for the usage time, only that here, rather than incrementing a variable, each time the screen is turned on, it keeps the current time in a variable, and when the screen is turned off, it subtracts that variable from this moment current time. However, it doesn't seem to work. My app is in french, so the Text View that should display the usage time is initialized to "0h et 0min". However, to display it on the screen, I have used this type of format: 00:00:00

The problem: When I run my code, the value is changed to 00:00:00 and then nothing happens. Even after using the phone for quite some time, it still at 00:00:00.

I tried to see where the problem could come from, but after a few trials and no change whatsoever, here I am. Here is my activity, called UserPageActivity:

    private void onparAppButtonClick(View view) {

    private void registerUnlockReceiver(){

The class extending BroadcastReceiver:

package com.example.digitalbalance1;

import android.content.BroadcastReceiver;
import android.content.Context;
import android.content.Intent;

import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileReader;
import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.IOException;

public class TempsUseReceiver extends BroadcastReceiver {
    private long countTime = 0;
    private long totalTime = 0;
    private boolean screenOn = true;
    //private static final String ACTION_COUNT_TIME = "com.example.digitalbalance1.COUNT_TIME";
    private static final String ACTION_STOP_TIME = "com.example.digitalbalance1.STOP_TIME";
    @Override
    public void onReceive(Context context, Intent intent) {
        String action = intent.getAction();
        if(action.equals(Intent.ACTION_SCREEN_ON)) {
            Intent startCount = new Intent(context, TempsUseService.class);
            startCount.setAction(ACTION_STOP_TIME);
            context.startService(startCount);
            countTime=System.currentTimeMillis();
            System.out.println("1"+countTime);
            screenOn=true;
        } else if (action.equals(Intent.ACTION_SCREEN_OFF)) {
            if(screenOn){
                Intent endCount = new Intent(context, TempsUseService.class);
                endCount.setAction(ACTION_STOP_TIME);
                context.startService(endCount);
                long endCountTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
                System.out.println("2"+endCountTime);
                long sessionTime = endCountTime-countTime;
                totalTime += sessionTime;
                updateTotalTime(context, totalTime);
            }
            screenOn=false;
        }
    }
    public long getCountTime(){return countTime;}
    private void updateTotalTime(Context context, long totalTime) {
        try {
            FileWriter writer = new FileWriter(getTotalTimeFile(context));
            writer.write(String.valueOf(totalTime));
            writer.close();
        } catch (IOException e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }

    private File getTotalTimeFile(Context context){
        File dir= context.getExternalFilesDir(null);
        if(dir!=null){
            return new File(dir, "totalTimeFile.txt");
        } else {
            //utiliser le stockage interne
            return new File(context.getFilesDir(), "totalTimeFile.txt");
        }
    }
    public long getTotalTime(Context context){
        File totalTimeFile = getTotalTimeFile(context);
        if(totalTimeFile.exists()){
            try{
                BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(totalTimeFile));
                String line = reader.readLine();
                System.out.println("3"+line);
                reader.close();
                try {
                    return Long.parseLong(line);
                } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
                    e.printStackTrace();
                }
            } catch (IOException e){
                e.printStackTrace();
            }
        }
        //Si le fichier n'existe pas ou il y'a erreur
        return 0;
    }
}

And finally my service class:

package com.example.digitalbalance1;

import android.app.Notification;
import android.app.NotificationChannel;
import android.app.NotificationManager;
import android.app.Service;
import android.content.Context;
import android.content.Intent;
import android.content.IntentFilter;
import android.os.Build;
import android.os.IBinder;

import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
import androidx.core.app.NotificationCompat;

import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.IOException;

public class TempsUseService extends Service {
    private TempsUseReceiver tempsUseReceiver;
    private static final int NOTIFICATION_ID = 2;
    private static final String CHANNEL_ID = "ForegroundServiceChannel";
    private long totalTime = 0;

    @Override
    public void onCreate(){
        super.onCreate();
        tempsUseReceiver=new TempsUseReceiver();
        registerTempsUseReceiver();
        startForeground(NOTIFICATION_ID, createNotification());
    }

    @Override
    public int onStartCommand(Intent intent, int flags, int startId){
        if(intent!=null && intent.getAction()!=null &&
        intent.getAction().equals("com.example.digitalbalance1.STOP_TIME")){
            long countTime= tempsUseReceiver.getCountTime();
            long currentTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
            long sessionTime = currentTime - countTime;
            totalTime += sessionTime;
            updateTotalTime(this, totalTime);
        }
        else if (intent!=null && intent.getAction()!=null &&
                intent.getAction().equals("com.example.digitalbalance1.UPDATE_TOTAL_TIME")) {
            long updatedTotalTime = intent.getLongExtra("totalTime", 0);
            if (updatedTotalTime != 0) {
                totalTime = updatedTotalTime;
            }
        }
        updateTotalTimeInUserPageActivity(totalTime);
        return START_STICKY;
    }

    private void updateTotalTimeInUserPageActivity(long totalTime) {
        Intent updateIntent = new Intent("com.example.digitalbalance1.STOP_TIME");
        updateIntent.putExtra("totalTime", totalTime);
        sendBroadcast(updateIntent);
    }
    private void registerTempsUseReceiver(){
        registerReceiver(tempsUseReceiver, new IntentFilter(Intent.ACTION_SCREEN_ON));
        registerReceiver(tempsUseReceiver, new IntentFilter(Intent.ACTION_SCREEN_OFF));
    }
    private void unregisterUnlockReceiver(){
        unregisterReceiver(tempsUseReceiver);
    }
    @Nullable
    @Override
    public IBinder onBind(Intent intent) {
        return null;
    }
    @Override
    public void onDestroy(){
        super.onDestroy();
        unregisterUnlockReceiver();
    }
    private Notification createNotification() {
        if (Build.VERSION.SDK_INT >= Build.VERSION_CODES.O) {
            NotificationChannel channel = new NotificationChannel(
                    CHANNEL_ID,
                    "Foreground Service Channel",
                    NotificationManager.IMPORTANCE_DEFAULT
            );
            NotificationManager manager = getSystemService(NotificationManager.class);
            manager.createNotificationChannel(channel);
        }

        NotificationCompat.Builder builder = new NotificationCompat.Builder(this, CHANNEL_ID)
                .setContentTitle("Temps d'utilisation")
                .setContentText("Evalue l'utilisation de votre appareil!")
                .setSmallIcon(R.drawable.healthy);

        return builder.build();
    }

    private void updateTotalTime(Context context, long totalTime) {
        File totalTimeFile = getTotalTimeFile(context);
        try {
            FileWriter writer = new FileWriter(totalTimeFile);
            writer.write(String.valueOf(totalTime));
            writer.close();
        } catch (IOException e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
        Intent updateIntent = new Intent("com.example.digitalbalance1.UPDATE_TOTAL_TIME");
        updateIntent.putExtra("totalTime", totalTime);
        context.sendBroadcast(updateIntent);
    }
    private File getTotalTimeFile(Context context){
        File dir= context.getExternalFilesDir(null);
        if(dir!=null){
            return new File(dir, "totalTimeFile.txt");
        } else {
            //utiliser le stockage interne
            return new File(context.getFilesDir(), "totalTimeFile.txt");
        }
    }

}

items.title: Spring `DynamicPropertySource` property is not available to `EnvironmentPostProcessor` - "chicken & egg"
items.body:
I'm trying to develop an EnvironmentPostProcessor to add a PropertySource to spring Environment. (following this howto).

This PropertySource relies on remote connection to some server (i.e. DB). I want the server-url to be provided using standard spring properties (application.properties, etc.).

This work as expected since at the time of EnvironmentPostProcessor.postProcessEnvironment invocation, the Environment has already been prepared with all the usual property sources that Spring Boot loads by default (including my server-url property).

The problem happens when I'm trying to use this EnvironmentPostProcessor on integration tests. On such tests I'm running a server using TestContainers and providing the server-url using DynamicPropertySource. It seems that DynamicPropertySource is handled after the EnvironmentPostProcessor thus I'm not able to get the correct server-url (so my EnvironmentPostProcessor can't connect correctly to fetch properties).

What it the recommended way to provide a custom PropertySource which relies on remote connection that should be configured externally (via tests too)?

Note: I'm aware of spring-cloud PropertySourceLocator but would like to achieve the same without dependency on bootstrap context.

MyEnvironmentPostProcessor (registered via META-INF/spring.factories):

public class MyEnvironmentPostProcessor implements EnvironmentPostProcessor {

  @Autowired
  private ApplicationContext applicationContext;

  @Override
  public void postProcessEnvironment(ConfigurableEnvironment environment,
                                     SpringApplication application) {

    String serverUrl = environment.getProperty("server-url");

    // use serverUrl to connect and create a PropertySource
    PropertySource remotePropertySource = ...

    // adding the remotePropertySource to Environment
    environment.getPropertySources().addFirst(remotePropertySource);
  }
}

Test code:

@SpringBootTest
public class DemoApplicationTest {

  // This will use TestContainers to spawn my remote server (etcd in this case)
  @RegisterExtension
  static EtcdClusterExtension cluster = EtcdClusterExtension.builder().build();

  // Using dynamic property source to provide correct value of remote server, hopefully to be used
  // by MyEnvironmentPostProcessor
  @DynamicPropertySource
  static void remoteServerProperties(DynamicPropertyRegistry registry) {
    registry.add("server-url", cluster::clientEndpoints);
  }
}
